description: Returns information about an execution of a pipeline, including details about artifacts, the pipeline execution ID, and the name, version, and status of the pipeline.

parameters.name: pipelineName
parameters.description: The name of the pipeline about which you want to get execution details.

parameters.name: pipelineExecutionId
parameters.description: The ID of the pipeline execution about which you want to get execution details.

nested_items.name: pipelineExecution
nested_items.description: Represents information about the execution of a pipeline.

nested_items.name: pipelineName
nested_items.description: The name of the pipeline with the specified pipeline execution.

nested_items.name: pipelineVersion
nested_items.description: The version number of the pipeline with the specified pipeline execution.

nested_items.name: pipelineExecutionId
nested_items.description: The ID of the pipeline execution.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the pipeline execution.
Cancelled: The pipeline's definition was updated before the pipeline execution could be completed.
InProgress: The pipeline execution is currently running.
Stopped: The pipeline execution was manually stopped. For more information, see Stopped Executions.

Stopping: The pipeline execution received a request to be manually stopped. Depending on the selected stop mode, the execution is either completing or abandoning in-progress actions. For more information, see Stopped Executions.
Succeeded: The pipeline execution was completed successfully.

Superseded: While this pipeline execution was waiting for the next stage to be completed, a newer pipeline execution advanced and continued through the pipeline instead. For more information, see Superseded Executions.
Failed: The pipeline execution was not completed successfully.

nested_items.name: statusSummary
nested_items.description: A summary that contains a description of the pipeline execution status.

nested_items.name: artifactRevisions
nested_items.description: A list of ArtifactRevision objects included in a pipeline execution.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of an artifact. This name might be system-generated, such as 'MyApp', or defined by the user when an action is created.

nested_items.name: revisionId
nested_items.description: The revision ID of the artifact.

nested_items.name: revisionChangeIdentifier
nested_items.description: An additional identifier for a revision, such as a commit date or, for artifacts stored in Amazon S3 buckets, the ETag value.

nested_items.name: revisionSummary
nested_items.description: Summary information about the most recent revision of the artifact. For GitHub and CodeCommit repositories, the commit message. For Amazon S3 buckets or actions, the user-provided content of a codepipeline-artifact-revision-summary key specified in the object metadata.

nested_items.name: created
nested_items.description: The date and time when the most recent revision of the artifact was created, in timestamp format.

nested_items.name: revisionUrl
nested_items.description: The commit ID for the artifact revision. For artifacts stored in GitHub or CodeCommit repositories, the commit ID is linked to a commit details page.

nested_items.name: variables
nested_items.description: A list of pipeline variables used for the pipeline execution.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of a pipeline-level variable.

nested_items.name: resolvedValue
nested_items.description: The resolved value of a pipeline-level variable.

nested_items.name: triggerType
nested_items.description: The type of change-detection method, command, or user interaction that started a pipeline execution.

nested_items.name: triggerDetail
nested_items.description: Detail related to the event that started a pipeline execution, such as the webhook ARN of the webhook that triggered the pipeline execution or the user ARN for a user-initiated start-pipeline-execution CLI command.

nested_items.name: executionMode
nested_items.description: The method that the pipeline will use to handle multiple executions. The default mode is SUPERSEDED.

nested_items.name: executionType
nested_items.description: The type of the pipeline execution.

nested_items.name: rollbackMetadata
nested_items.description: The metadata about the execution pertaining to stage rollback.

nested_items.name: rollbackTargetPipelineExecutionId
nested_items.description: The pipeline execution ID to which the stage will be rolled back.
